events.message: The applicant submitted a personal loan application to cover upcoming medical expenses and related costs.
The loan application was categorized as a personal loan based on the purpose stated for medical needs.
A loan officer was assigned to manage the personal loan application and guide the applicant through the process.
The initial review was completed, confirming that all required personal details and loan purpose were clearly stated.
Request was sent to the applicant for submission of medical bills, identity proof and income statements.
The applicant promptly submitted all requested documents including medical invoices and bank statements.
Credit check was completed and revealed a reasonably good credit history with no overdue loans.
Risk assessment concluded that the applicant's financial profile poses moderate risk, acceptable under current guidelines.
A loan offer outlining terms, interest rates, and repayment schedule was presented to the applicant for review.
The applicant expressed satisfaction with the offer and requested clarification on early repayment options.
The application was escalated to the senior loan committee for approval of a slightly higher loan amount.
Senior loan committee approved the personal loan as requested with favorable repayment terms.
Approved loan amount was successfully disbursed into the applicantâ€™s bank account for medical expenses.
Follow-up was conducted to ensure the applicant had no further questions regarding the loan repayment schedule.
The loan application file was formally closed after confirming all post-approval documentation was completed.
